Dynamic map

Source: R/tar_dynamic_map.R
tar_dynamic_map.Rd

Iterate over one or more targets in sequence.

tar_dynamic_map(...)

Arguments

...

Data frames with columns to represent targets and elements to represent branches or buds. Column names must be unique across all the data frames.

Details

In tar_target(), pattern = map(x, y) creates one dynamic branch for the first element of x and the first element of y, another for the second element of x and the second element of y, and so on. To test and experiment with this behavior outside the pipeline, use the tar_dynamic_map() function.

See also

Other Dynamic branching: tar_dynamic_cross(), tar_dynamic_head(), tar_dynamic_sample(), tar_dynamic_tail()

Examples

# To use dynamic map for real in a pipeline,
# call map() in a target's pattern.
# The following code goes at the bottom of _targets.R.
tar_pipeline(
  tar_target(x, seq_len(2)),
  tar_target(y, head(letters, 2)),
  tar_target(dynamic, c(x, y), pattern = map(x, y)) # 2 branches
)

#> <pipeline with 3 targets>
# To explore dynamic map() outside a pipeline,
# use the tar_dynamic_map() helper function.
x <- data.frame(x = seq_len(2))
y <- data.frame(y = head(letters, 2))
tar_dynamic_map(x, y)

#>   x y
#> 1 1 a
#> 2 2 b
# You can experiment with more complicated patterns.
# The following is a representation of pattern = cross(z, map(x, y)).
z <- data.frame(z = tail(LETTERS, 2))
tar_dynamic_cross(z, tar_dynamic_map(x, y))

#>   z x y
#> 1 Y 1 a
#> 2 Y 2 b
#> 3 Z 1 a
#> 4 Z 2 b
